The sign of the dove was instituted before the creation of the world, a witness for the Holy Ghost, and the devil cannot come in the sign of a dove. The Holy Ghost is a personage, and is in the form of a personage.2 It does not confine itself to the form of the dove, but in sign of the dove. The Holy Ghost cannot be transformed into a dove; but the sign of a dove was given to John to signify the truth of the deed, as the dove is an emblem or token of truth and innocence.

Thirdly. John, at that time, was the only legal administrator in the affairs of the kingdom3 there was then on the earth, and holding the keys of power. The Jews had to obey his instructions or be damned,4 by their own law; and Christ Himself fulfilled all righteousness5 in becoming obedient to the law which he had given to Moses on the mount,6 and thereby magnified it and made it honorable, instead of destroying it. The son of Zacharias wrested the keys, the kingdom,7 the power, the glory from the Jews, by the holy anointing8 and decree of heaven, and these three reasons constitute him the greatest prophet born of a woman.9

Christ Considered Least in the Kingdom by Jews

Second question:—How was the least in the kingdom of heaven greater than he?

In reply I asked—Whom did Jesus have reference to as being the least? Jesus was looked upon as having the least claim in God’s kingdom, and [seemingly] was least entitled to their credulity as a prophet; as though He had said—“He that is considered the least among you is greater than John—that is I myself.”10

The Parables of Jesus and the Interpretation of the Scriptures

In reference to the prodigal son,11 I said it was a subject I had never dwelt upon; that it was understood by many to be one of the intricate subjects of the scriptures; and even the Elders of this Church have preached largely upon it, without having any rule of interpretation. What is the rule of interpretation? Just no interpretation at all. Understand it precisely as it reads. I have a key by which I understand the scriptures.
